content.description: Top It Off starts off with a 5.9 crux that is thinner and steeper than anything on Red Eye Express (although similar in nature).  Midway through the route, there are some great cracks.  A small bulge must be reckoned with to reach the belay.  More easy pockets and edges on a low incline lead above the belay anchors to a rightward arching lip.  A lieback crux guards the top.  A rightward shuffle leads to the anchor.  I wouldn't be surprised if most people skip the top 40 feet or so and just do the first pitch.
content.protection: 13 black bolts (if leading in one long pitch) or 8 QDs for the first and 4 QDs for the second.  A 2 chain belay station (anchors for Red Eye Express) facilitate a rappel for those with shorter ropes.  A single rappel with a 70 meter rope is possible from the 2 chain anchor at the top; otherwise, a two rope rappel from the top would suffice.
content.location: Top It Off is the second bolt line from the left.  Rappel from the top anchors to the belay anchors for Red Eye Express and make a second rappel unless you have two ropes for a two rope rappel or a 70 meter rope.

content.description: Once atop Mad Millennium or The Creeper, the angle of the wall eases.  Climb on positive edges to a steep section.  Balance your way through on some thin holds and jams that slope the wrong direction and you'll defeat the crux of the wall.  I would recommend carrying 6 extra QDs and combining this route with The Creeper.  According to the FA data I had, this route wasn't put up on Superbowl Sunday, but on a Friday.  Perhaps this was a pre-game attraction?
content.protection: 5 silver bolts to a 2 chain anchor shared with Top It Off.
content.location: Superbowl is the second pitch for either The Creeper or Mad Millennium, but either combination can be led in one pitch.  A 70 meter rope will reach the bottom left of the wall; otherwise, employ a two rope rappel from the top, or rappel to the anchor for The Creeper and Mad Millennium and make another rappel.

content.description: Red Eye Express is the logical warm up of the wall.  Small pockets are the primary feature.  It isn't very steep, but it isn't a slab either.  Once you get the technique down, you'll be flying up all the routes here.
content.protection: 8 black bolts to a 2 chain anchor.
content.location: Red Eye Express is the bolt line on the far left.  Rappel from the 2 chain anchor.

content.description: Even though Mad Millennium is one of the easier routes here, it is probably the most consistent and enjoyable.  Small pockets and some bigger edges are the common features, but there are a few bigger crimps, jugs and cracks to play with.  What a great way to start out the new millennium!
content.protection: 7 silver bolts to a 2 chain anchor shared with The Creeper to the right.  The last bolt is also shared with The Creeper.
content.location: Mad Millennium is the second climb from the right.  Rappel from the 2 chain anchor at the top.

content.description: Creep up one of the steeper sections of the wall through a sea of slopers, edges, pockets, underclings, crimps and other goodies.  It isn't very physically demanding, but does require balance and technique.  Don't drift to the left or you'll end up on the neighboring route.
content.protection: 9 silver bolts to a 2 chain anchor shared with Mad Millennium.  The last bolt is also shared with Mad Millennium.
content.location: The Creeper climbs the bolt line on the far right.  Rappel from the 2 chain anchor at the top.
